title: [K-12] Applying CSCL and CoI Frameworks for Online Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with online learning platforms and basic social science knowledge
context.additional_context: Students perform projects analyzing social phenomena, conducting collaborative learning using online discussion tools.

learning_goals: Learners can implement the three elements of the CoI (Community of Inquiry) framework (social, cognitive, teaching presence) using online discussion tools.
Learners can improve discussion participation by over 30% using cognitive tools (e.g., idea mapping, structured questioning) in a CSCL (Computer-Supported Collaborative Learning) environment.
Learners achieve a project contribution recognition score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point scale through peer evaluation and feedback systems in collaborative learning.

resources: Online Discussion Platforms (Zoom Breakout Rooms, Padlet)
Collaborative Tools within Learning Management Systems (LMS)
Pre-Developed CoI (Community of Inquiry) Assessment Surveys

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
